main event: On January 16, 1959, a luminous round flying object was observed in Litschau, Czechoslovakia, crossing the border into Austrian airspace at high speed, hovering, circling, and then returning across the border at high speed within 2 minutes. The object was observed for 2 minutes by Austrian aircraft and witnessed by observers.
interesting points: The flying object exhibited rapid and unusual movement, crossing borders at high speed and circling before disappearing.
The speed of the object was comparable to Czech jets cruising near the border, indicating advanced capabilities.
The object's behavior suggested the possibility of guided rocket technology, either autonomous or remotely controlled.
The observation was made by Austrian aircraft, adding credibility to the sighting.
The sighting lasted for a relatively short duration of 2 minutes but involved detailed observation of the object's movements.
